column4: hi everyone, i need some help with synaptic (yup im a newbie :S) , i need some info about the "updates" tab in repositories, i see on the wiki that proposed and backport aare not (or better may not be) fully tested, now i seem to understand that only some people (mainly developers) can put stuff in the repos (please correct me if im wrong) does that mean that while they re not tested they re still somehow safe to install or that not tested means that some
random joe may put some nasty stuff in the repos?
its not likely bad stuff will be there
what do u mean malicious?
litterally malware, if you consider it as anything that may harm my privacy / security
no there wont be, and if there was it'd be removed very quickly and all over the web
it can be confusing, a bit like the "there are no viruses for linux" there's always people who say "but there has been".... irl they dont exist
1 reason why i switched from os x lol
cant you just use a normal router? i use an old wrt54g with tomato firmware does everything, and dont take up a load of power
i have  a wag320n, no custom firmwares :S
sadly not here lol it costed like 150$
3rd party firmware is good though, iptables etc
i know its good but bootloader is locked
youd be better off looking on ebay or amazon or something for a cheap router thats compatable with 3rd party firmware
so you re somehow stating mine would not actually be good/reliable/secure?
if u have a router, but you cant put 3rd party f/w on it its still good (for routing)
disable ssh / telnet whatever on your router and dont worry about it
any access from remote (the only being webmin) is disabled, spi and nat firewall are on
id say so firmware updates normally oinly fix bugs
common ones are linksys and buffalo for 3rd party fw
sadly i picked the locked one lol pwnt
dont worry about it i use a router from 2005 just use it and stop worrying
thanks for the support :D
